abstract: Medtronic captured about two-thirds of the American market share lost by Boston Scientific during its monthlong suspension of defibrillator sales.
snippet: Medtronic captured about two-thirds of the American market share lost by Boston Scientific during its monthlong suspension of defibrillator sales.
lead_paragraph: Medtronic, the maker of heart rhythm devices, said on Tuesday that its fourth-quarter profit surged eightfold on higher sales of defibrillators after a rival, Boston Scientific, had to withdraw its products from the market.

headline.main: Profit Surges at Medtronic After a Rival Has Trouble
headline.print_headline: Profit Surges At Medtronic After a Rival Has Trouble
